title: UPDATE: Savannah teen dies after being shot Thursday night
content:
Today, Violent Crimes detectives of Savannah-Chatham police department are investigating a Thursday night shooting that claimed the life of a Savannah teenager.
About 10:32 p.m., metro responded to a shooting on the 600 block West 54th Street, said Eunicia Baker, police spokeswoman. Responding officers discovered that 15-year-old Jamari Batts, of Madison Apartments, had been shot.
In critical condition, Jamari was transported by ambulance to Memorial University Medical Center, where he died today.
This investigation continues. Anyone with information on the case is asked to call Crimestoppers at 912-234-2020 or text CRIMES (274637) using the keyword CSTOP2020. Tipsters remain anonymous and may qualify for a cash reward.
A confidential tip line also is open directly to investigators at 912-525-3124.
From Thursday evening:
Police say a teenager was hospitalized after being shot Thursday night in Savannah.
Officers were called to Madison Apartments on West 54th Street just after 10:30 p.m., where they found a male in his mid-teens suffering from a gunshot wound, said Julian Miller, Savannah-Chatham police spokesman.
The shooting victim, who lives at the complex, was taken to Memorial University Medical Center with injuries police believed to be potentially serious.
The shooting occurred outside an apartment, Miller said, and police are asking witnesses to come forward. A large crowd was in the area immediately following the shooting, Miller said.
A heavy police presence was at the complex, including members of a task force and state troopers assisting metro officers.
Detectives were on scene late Thursday as the investigation was getting underway.
No further information was immediately available.
Earlier Thursday, about 6:45 p.m., police said three people were shot on Savannah's eastside.
Officers were called to East Bolton Street near Ash Street, where they found two males suffering from gunshot wounds, Miller said.
About the same time, a woman suffering from gunshot wounds arrived at Memorial via private vehicle, Miller said. The extent of the shooting victims’ injuries was not immediately known.
Miller said many people were in the area when shots were fired, and police are asking people to come forward with information.
Anyone with information that can help police is asked to call CrimeStoppers at 912-234-2020 or text CRIMES (274637) using the keyword CSTOP2020. Tipsters remain anonymous and may qualify for a cash reward.
A confidential tip line also is open directly to investigators at 912-525-3124.
